module.p: càit where is a question word (interrogative adverb).

li.gd: Càit a bheil an gille beag an diugh? Tha e anns an sgoil.
li.tr: Where is the little boy today? He is in the school.

li.gd: A bheil Seònaid anns an sgoil an diugh? Chan eil. Càit a bheil i? Tha i anns an taigh.
li.tr: Is Janet in the school today? No, she isn’t. Where is she? She is in the house.

li.gd: Càit a bheil an cat bàn an diugh? Tha e anns an taigh còmhla ri Seònaid.
li.tr: Where is the white cat today? It is in the house along with Janet.

li.gd: Càit a bheil an cat? Tha e aig an teine.
li.tr: Where is the cat? It is by the fire.

li.gd: A bheil an cù aig an teine? Chan eil. Càit a bheil e? Tha e anns an achadh an diugh.
li.tr: Is the dog by the fire. No, it isn’t. Where is it? It is in the field today.

li.gd: Càit a bheil an gual? Air an teine.
li.tr: Where is the coal? On the fire.

li.gd: Càit a bheil Seumas ag obair? Tha e trang ag obair anns an achadh.
li.tr: Where is James working? He is busy working in the field.

li.gd: Càit a bheil a’ chaileag? Tha i anns an taigh.
li.tr: Where is the girl? She is in the house.

li.gd: Càit a bheil i a’ cluich? Tha i a’ cluich air an làr.
li.tr: Where is she playing? She is playing on the floor.

section.p:
Càite an deach/tèid/rachadh ... ? Where did/will/would ... go? –
pedagogical examples –
Càit a bheil thu a’ dol? Tha mi a’ dol a-null thairis a Pharas. | Càite am bi sinn a’ dol a-nochd?
Where are you going? I am going abroad to Paris. | Where will we be going tonight? td. 66, 116
